I felt a little sick after finishing my bowl just cause it was so intensely rich. If they could thin out the broth a bit, then this would be perfect! 

Plus, the wait is insane. If you're not there at least 30 min before opening you'll have to wait 1 hour minimum. The service is fast but the restaurant is just so small that they can only seat 40ish people at a time.

excerpts: I felt that it was appropriate to get the Tori Paitan because that is what most first timers get.
I am excessive and fall into the traps of frequent ramen eaters; TOPPINGS GALORE!
You know I had to add fried garlic, extra duck, extra menma.
I wanted the miso egg
tori paitan.author: Fiona V.
tori paitan.review:
5 stars!!! I jumped on the hype much recently after the 4 hour waits are over. This time, my wait was about 30 minutes which is basically "no wait" if you live in the Bay Area.

OK, THE FOOD....


I felt that it was appropriate to get the Tori Paitan because that is what most first timers get. I am excessive and fall into the traps of frequent ramen eaters; TOPPINGS GALORE! You know I had to add fried garlic, extra duck, extra menma. I wanted the miso egg but I guess everyone else had the same idea.... which gave me only one option, the soy sauce egg.

Based on appearance, the broth has a darker color. I expected a very heavy thick broth but it was duck dynasty love at first slurp. The subtle hints of duck was perfect; it wasn't underwhelming neither was it overpowering. The huge soup spoons are slurp friendly The noodles are thicker than any other ramen noodle I've had, similar to a cross of udon/egg noodle/ramen trybrid. (is that a word?)

The cuts of duck breast (?) were succulent, juicy, and moist. When I think of duck, I think of fat but these cuts were nothing like that. 

THE EGG! Great egg, the yolk was cooked but still had the gooey sticky texture that most of us egg enthusiasts look for.

I don't mean to hype it up but...yes, join the hype. Be an active member of this hype because it is hype for a reason.

excerpts: I got the Tori paitan ramen and my friends got the spicy lamb and Tori paitan x2 chasu.
A lot of people complain about the broth being too heavy
but I think it's perfect, super creamy and rich!
The chasu was so soft and literally melts in your mouth.
We finished the ramen in 30 minutes.
The place is pretty small so place gets packed instantly.
Knocked off one star because of the wait time.
I would recommend coming here if you have a lot of time to waste.
tori paitan.author: Tina C.
tori paitan.review: Got here on a Saturday night at 6pm and got seated at 7:30! I got the Tori paitan ramen and my friends got the spicy lamb and Tori paitan x2 chasu. A lot of people complain about the broth being too heavy but I think it's perfect, super creamy and rich! The chasu was so soft and literally melts in your mouth. We finished the ramen in 30 minutes. The place is pretty small so place gets packed instantly. Knocked off one star because of the wait time. I would recommend coming here if you have a lot of time to waste.

excerpts: I ordered the shio chashu ramen and my bf ordered the tori paitan.
The tori paitan had a really thick broth, and was really rich and creamy.
The duck charsiu was also really tender and just melts in your mouth.
My shio chashu ramen was quite plain and felt like it lacked flavor.
I had to ask them for some chili oil to add some kick to it.
tori paitan.author: Lisa H.
tori paitan.review:
Came here on a Sunday around 6pm and there was a line outside the door. This was my first time here and I've heard that it was the new spot that was originally from Japan. The place was pretty small and their menu had a limited selection because it's still pretty new. The inside of the restaurant was pretty small so you will most likely be sharing a table with others. It took about an hour wait to finally get inside and sit down and eat. 

We quickly looked at the menu and they took our orders. I ordered the shio chashu ramen and my bf ordered the tori paitan. The tori paitan had a really thick broth, and was really rich and creamy. The duck charsiu was also really tender and just melts in your mouth. My shio chashu ramen was quite plain and felt like it lacked flavor. I had to ask them for some chili oil to add some kick to it. They also have very limited condiments that are on the table. 

Would I come back? Probably not. It's definitely overpriced for what they serve, and not worth the wait. It's also located in a sketchy area where bums would sometimes come inside the restaurant and ask for money. It's a cool place to try, but to be a fan of it, I think I will pass.

excerpts: I got the signature ramen tori paitan and my friend ordered the vegan tantanmen.
The noodles were a great consistency but the broth was way too creamy and heavy for my palette.
It was also on the salty side.
The pork chashu was a highlight and melted in my mouth!
We also ordered the enoki chips which were fun but very greasy.
Overall fun experience and glad
we came but the ramen was just average and isn't justified by the long wait.
tori paitan.author: Yin H.
tori paitan.review: Mensho was good but didn't live up to my expectations and the hype. We got here around 6 on a cold Friday night. The line didn't look long at all but then we realized the restaurant was tiny!! We waited about 45 min before being seated. The waitress had already taken our orders while we were in line. Our orders came out pretty quickly. I got the signature ramen tori paitan and my friend ordered the vegan tantanmen. The noodles were a great consistency but the broth was way too creamy and heavy for my palette. It was also on the salty side. The pork chashu was a highlight and melted in my mouth! We also ordered the enoki chips which were fun but very greasy. Overall fun experience and glad we came but the ramen was just average and isn't justified by the long wait.

excerpts: I was skeptical at first but with one bite of the Tori Paitan ramen, my only thought was 'Whoa, that's good!'
tori paitan.author: Cicely T.
tori paitan.review:
This place deserves all the hype and it worth the wait in line. I was skeptical at first but with one bite of the Tori Paitan ramen, my only thought was 'Whoa, that's good!'

It is a creamier, heavier broth than most ramen places but oh so very very flavorful. Also, the noodles were cooked perfectly. They were not soft and soogy which is a bit of a no no for me. Noodle texture is important. The kale was tasty too and a good veggie in the bowl.

My friend and I arrived at 645 pm on a Thursday night. There were about 12 people in front of us, but mostly couples so the line went by fast. We were seated about 25 minutes and happily slurping away our noodles about 10 minutes after that. It is a small place but the service is good and attentive when needed.

Only criticism is the price as I am not sure a bowl of ramen should be that much $ and also my cha-su was super fatty -too fatty for me to eat. Other than that, I will be going back!

excerpts: First, we had the tori paitan with extra chashu.
The broth is very hearty and fatty (creamy taste always equals high fat content).
The ramen was firm and held up well.
However, where was my ajitsuke tamari!?
This is Japanese for soft boiled egg and I am not sure why they don't also serve this as an option.
tori paitan.author: Corey H.
tori paitan.review:
I braved the 1.5 hour wait on Saturday evening to see if this place would live up to the hype. My thoughts are mixed. I really wanted to like it but I'm not 100% sold.

On to the review, the service was excellent and once we were in the restaurant we were seated and given menus but not rushed even though it was jam packed.

The menu is spartan and focuses on the ramen. I would love to return here once they have some more of what I consider necessary side staples such as karaage or takowasa. 

First, we had the tori paitan with extra chashu. The broth is very hearty and fatty (creamy taste always equals high fat content). The ramen was firm and held up well. However, where was my ajitsuke tamari!? This is Japanese for soft boiled egg and I am not sure why they don't also serve this as an option. My guess is this will be added later but it was sorely missed.

Second, we had shoyu ramen. I actually liked this better than the first bowl because the broth was lighter. Now, I did know what I was getting into by trying the fattier broth; however, if you are watching your figure or want something light stick to shoyu.

Finally, we tried the appetizer oysters in shoyu dare oil because it was option one of two. The oysters were ok to me not bad but not amazing.

In sum, I was a bit disappointed because things that I consider fundamental to a good ramen experience and ramen dining experience were missing. Admittedly, the appetizers do not make the ramen but the ajitsuke surely does.

I will have to return and give this place another after they introduce the full menu. 頑張ってね！

excerpts: Have only tried Tori Paitan but the rest are definitely on my list.
Small place which explains the long line.
Also small menu but BIG on flavor.
The dish itself is the best I've had in the city.
Noodles are perfect, not skinny or too thick and cooked just right.
All the accompaniments paired well; fried gobo, chives, cabbage, bamboo shoots (although my partner felt it was overwhelming, I thought it was fine) and meat (pork and duck).
Pork and duck was so tender and juicy.
I personally love the use of kale instead of the usual leafy greens in ramen.
I thought I was the only one that did that.
If you have the patience to wait (at least an hour if you come before they open) and love ramen as much as I do it's worth the almost $20 for a bowl of noodles.
I wish it was more $15
tori paitan.author: Naty D.
tori paitan.review:
Solid 4 stars! Have only tried Tori Paitan but the rest are definitely on my list. Small place which explains the long line. Also small menu but BIG on flavor. 
The dish itself is the best I've had in the city. Noodles are perfect, not skinny or too thick and cooked just right. All the accompaniments paired well; fried gobo, chives, cabbage, bamboo shoots (although my partner felt it was overwhelming, I thought it was fine) and meat (pork and duck).  Pork and duck was so tender and juicy.  I personally love the use of kale instead of the usual leafy greens in ramen. I thought I was the only one that did that. 
If you have the patience to wait (at least an hour if you come before they open) and love ramen as much as I do it's worth the almost $20 for a bowl of noodles.  I wish it was more $15

excerpts: Let's just say, Tori Paitan with double meat never fails to hit the spot.
The thick, indulgent broth is just a whole another world.
Have you seen that gif of Drake sitting in a bowl of ramen?
That.
tori paitan.author: Winnie I.
tori paitan.review:
I've been here far too many times for my own good. 

Let's just say, Tori Paitan with double meat never fails to hit the spot. The thick, indulgent broth is just a whole another world. Have you seen that gif of Drake sitting in a bowl of ramen?* That. That is exactly how I feel with each slurp. 

The Mazesoba is also amazing. (Note: If you get spicy, you will absolutely start feeling the heat) Their spicy mazesoba was actually spicy! You know when you really want a kick but most of the time only get a poke of spice instead? This is not the case. The flavor is rich and with the combination of the multiple dimensions in this dish leaves you wanting more after each bite, even if your mouth is burning up like a volcano.

My go-to when I'm feeling ramen in the city! Beware, people are not exaggerating when they proclaim the wait is at least one hour. Get there early and be hungry. 

*https://media3.giphy.com/media/l0HlJHK6QjMxzMKGc/giphy.gif - The infamous gif.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan.
It was really creamy!
The broth was perfect and the flavor was on point.
Definitely hit the spot especially since I was starving!
tori paitan.author: Nhu N.
tori paitan.review: This place opens at 5PM. We came at 5:07PM and there was already a wait!! We were probably 10th in line and it took us an hour to get seated :(. The restaurant is really small... I didn't like the seatings and the wait time. But the ramen was definitely worth it. I ordered the Tori Paitan. It was really creamy! The broth was perfect and the flavor was on point. Definitely hit the spot especially since I was starving!

excerpts: I ordered tori paitan noodles, which is probably one of the safer items to pick.
To me, if a restaurant cannot get the basics down, they cannot do much.
The broth was really creamy (and oily), but the flavor was not there.
The noodles are were actually really good, the texture is almost perfect.
tori paitan.author: Nicholas H.
tori paitan.review:
Based on the high reviews on Mensho Tokyo, I walked in with high expectations. Personally, I think this place is  overrated. The service is really friendly and the atmosphere is designed beautifully, but that's not why I came in. I ordered tori paitan noodles, which is probably one of the safer items to pick. To me, if a restaurant cannot get the basics down, they cannot do much. The broth was really creamy (and oily), but the flavor was not there. The noodles are were actually really good, the texture is almost perfect. I wouldn't recommend this noodle shop to my friends, but if someone was visiting SF then I would point them here.

P.S. This place is saturated with techies looking for a quick bite after work so expect a long wait.

excerpts:
One of the few Tori paitan ramen in the Bay Area. 
Ramen is definitely a preference thing. 
The tori paitan is very flavorful and on the lighter side.
tori paitan.author: tsubasa m.
tori paitan.review:
Probably the best ramen in sf. 

One of the few Tori paitan ramen in the Bay Area. 
Ramen is definitely a preference thing. Some prefer miso, shoyu, tonkotsu, etc

Oh btw it is not tonkatsu. It's tonkotsu. Tonkatsu is pork cutlet. Tonkotsu is pork bone. Get it right.

The tori paitan is very flavorful and on the lighter side. 
I'm not a fan of the very heavy "kotteri" soup that is very popular in the Bay Area.

They also have great noodles. I prefer the thicker noodles  "chijiri" rather than the thin noodles. 

Since we have not gotten Ichiran, ippudo, or afuri ramen yet in the Bay Area, this is probably the best place at the moment.

excerpts: We both ordered the Tori Paitan since it was the most popular.
I've read that many people enjoyed the thick and rich broth, but we weren't loving it after the first few bites.
I would be back, but I'm only willing to wait an hour and try something else.
All in all, it was alright and is still hyped up.
Also, probably the most expensive ramen I've had.
tori paitan.author: Maggie W.
tori paitan.review: 3.5 ~ On a Thursday night we arrived at 5:30PM. We waited 2 hours, which is one reason for my low rating. I'm not really a fan of the tables because I couldn't really communicate with my friend. We both ordered the Tori Paitan since it was the most popular. I've read that many people enjoyed the thick and rich broth, but we weren't loving it after the first few bites. I would be back, but I'm only willing to wait an hour and try something else. All in all, it was alright and is still hyped up. Also, probably the most expensive ramen I've had.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan while my friend ordered the Shio.
I got Tori Paitan because everyone raved about it - for me, it was very rich and flavorful, however too creamy and heavy for me.
It didn't even taste like broth anymore, it was like a gravy sauce, which I was not a fan of.
I was jealous of my friend's Shio because it was so flavorful and light.
I gave my Tori Paitan 2.5 stars and he gave his 5.
I do agree that the noodles are really good here though.
This time I ordered the Shio and my friend ordered the Organic Shoyu.
Shio was much better than the Tori Paitan I ordered before, but I thought my bowl was a little bit salty.
Shio was much better than the Tori Paitan I ordered before, but I thought my bowl was a little bit salty.
I tried the Shoyu which tasted similar to the Shio but with a kick of light soy sauce.
Noodles were great again, pork was not bad, but flawed in the broth again.
tori paitan.author: Raquel Y.
tori paitan.review:
Oh Mensho... so this is my #71 ramen review in my ramen list (can you believe that?!). Yes, I'm a bit obsessed with ramen and friends nicknamed me "Ramen Sheriff." Check out my ramen list attached :) 

So when the talk of the town was that Mensho was everyone's new favorite ramen spot, I had to try it for myself. I tried 2 of their bowls at 2 different occasions: 

[May 2016]
I ordered the Tori Paitan while my friend ordered the Shio. I got Tori Paitan because everyone raved about it - for me, it was very rich and flavorful, however too creamy and heavy for me. It didn't even taste like broth anymore, it was like a gravy sauce, which I was not a fan of. I was jealous of my friend's Shio because it was so flavorful and light. I gave my Tori Paitan 2.5 stars and he gave his 5. I do agree that the noodles are really good here though. Perfect texture and taste. 

[Oct 2016]
Decided to give Mensho another chance. This time I ordered the Shio and my friend ordered the Organic Shoyu. Shio was much better than the Tori Paitan I ordered before, but I thought my bowl was a little bit salty. I tried the Shoyu which tasted similar to the Shio but with a kick of light soy sauce. Noodles were great again, pork was not bad, but flawed in the broth again. I was hoping second time around would have me agree with everyone else, but with the amount of ramen bowls I've had, I can't help but compare.

OVERALL: Mensho has great texture and taste for their noodles and decent pork, however although their broths are unique and somewhat similar to Japan, it still does not quite hit the spot. If you really want authentic ramen, hit up Clint at Noodle in Haystack and reserve one of his pop up ramen dinners! It's the closest thing you'll get to Japan :)

excerpts: The Tori Paitan Double Chasu had some of the richest, flavorful broth I've ever tasted.
The ramen noodles were equally as impressive, not at all overcooked and had a great texture and chew to them.
The pork was succulent and fatty, just how I like it.
tori paitan.author: Chelsea P.
tori paitan.review:
I'm going to go ahead and say this was the best ramen I've ever had. However I will be going to Japan next spring, so I reserve the right to revoke this statement in the future. But Mensho is certainly my new favorite ramen joint in SF!

I overheard some skeptics in the restaurant saying the ramen lacked traditional staples like corn and hard boiled egg, but I could care less. The Tori Paitan Double Chasu had some of the richest, flavorful broth I've ever tasted. The ramen noodles were equally as impressive, not at all overcooked and had a great texture and chew to them. The pork was succulent and fatty, just how I like it. It was decadent and filling, and rightly so for $18.

My sister and I arrived at 4:40pm just before they opened on a Thursday and there were less than 10 people lined up outside. Come early and come hungry!

excerpts: The creaminess was amazing with so much flavorful taste from the broth, we also had the most popular tori paitan with pork and chicken broth, which was also amazing very creamy though if you prefer less creamy go for the shio or shoyu.
Definetly expect to wait in line so the earlier you come to the better ;)
tori paitan.author: Cheryl P.
tori paitan.review:
We came on a sunday night around 9 & waited about 30 mins, the place Isnt very big so they definitely want you to eat fast because theres usually a long line outside of the place. They only have a few items on the menu but everything is pretty go id quality and taste great! 
The ingredients in the ramen overall here is some of the best, as they balance all the key components of ramen very well. I got the vegan tantamen ramen which was one of the best ramen ive ever had vegan or not. I love the ramen spots in so val like hakata sen gumi yen, kita kata, Kopan (Orange county) Tsujita and daikokuya in LA and MENSHO is up there with those places for me =D
The creaminess was amazing with so much flavorful taste from the broth, we also had the most popular tori paitan with pork and chicken broth, which was also amazing very creamy though if you prefer less creamy go for the shio or shoyu.
 Definetly expect to wait in line so the earlier you come to the better ;)

excerpts: My girlfriend and I ordered Tan Tan Ramen and Tori Paitan Ramen.
When i first tried the Tan Tan Ramen, which was a vegetarian ramen, I was in shocked on how delicious that soup was!
In addition, the texture of the noodles were just right.
Not too raw, and not to cooked either.
It was just right!
Tan Tan Ramen didn't even taste like vegetables, I felt like I've eaten some type of meat there.
I believe that's because this ramen was genuinely made for vegetarian as if they were eating meat!
Which was brilliant!
As for Tor Paitan Ramen, it was also yummy!
the meat was great and the vegetables and fried onions made the taste even better!
We finished them ramen in just 25 min, paid, said goodbye to everyone, and left!
Even in the Uber's car, we kept on reminiscing on how great those ramens were.
tori paitan.author: Aldo H.
tori paitan.review:
This restaurant was located in San Francisco and was recommended to me by my baby brother and friends. As a group, we decided to go check it out. We came with a group of seven and we decided to come early at 4:30pm before door was open. We took Uber there and as soon as we got out of the car, to our surprise, the line was already halfway long! When the door was finally opened at exactly 5:00pm sharp, the first wave of people in the line came in to be seated and unfortunately, we had to wait for our turn. Keep in mind that we have seven people in our group. Now the challenge was that my girlfriend and I needed to go back to LA and we only had an hour to eat as we also needed to Uber to the Oakland airport, which was cutting it very close. We decided to risk it and waited for our turn as we broke the group into two and five instead of seven people in a group. 

As soon as a couple was leaving, my girlfriend and I was seated. It was kind of awkward at first because the seating distance between me and my neighbors between me were too close. However, we came there to eat and that's what we wanted to focus on, the food! As soon as we finished ordering, the workers there were kind enough to wait for the five people that were sitting around us to finish eating altogether and offered them seats to my brothers and friends! So we ended up sitting together as a group and I was very grateful! 

Phew that was a long backstory, but it was necessary to be told because I wanted to focus on how delicious these ramen were although we were in a rush! My girlfriend and I ordered Tan Tan Ramen and Tori Paitan Ramen. When i first tried the Tan Tan Ramen, which was a vegetarian ramen, I was in shocked on how delicious that soup was! In addition, the texture of the noodles were just right. Not too raw, and not to cooked either. It was just right! Tan Tan Ramen didn't even taste like vegetables, I felt like I've eaten some type of meat there. I believe that's because this ramen was genuinely made for vegetarian as if they were eating meat! Which was brilliant! As for Tor Paitan Ramen, it was also yummy! the meat was great and the vegetables and fried onions made the taste even better! We finished them ramen in just 25 min, paid, said goodbye to everyone, and left! Even in the Uber's car, we kept on reminiscing on how great those ramens were.

excerpts: Over $50 for two bowls of ramen and two beers was a bit out of bounds for me, but now I know what Tori Paitan is, and it's my new go to meal before my cocktails and cigar up the street at Rye.
tori paitan.author: Ron L.
tori paitan.review:
I used to live in Japan, and my childhood memories of ramen was not like this.

Over $50 for two bowls of ramen and two beers was a bit out of bounds for me, but now I know what Tori Paitan is, and it's my new go to meal before my cocktails and cigar up the street at Rye.

excerpts: ++ Tori Paitan Ramen (Double Chashu) $18
I think it was hard to notice the chashu in the tori paitan, due to the decadence of the soup, but in the shoyu, the chashu is a fatty standout.
probably the best chashu in a ramen that i've had.
the noodles in the shoyu are good, but different - thinner and lighter than it's tori paitan counterpart.
it paired well w/ the shoyu broth.
tori paitan.author: Erika C.
tori paitan.review:
Three stars for the noodles themselves. The soups I tried left much to be desired. Neither ramen that I tried would bring me back. I feel like I'm supposed to like this place because it's so hot right now. and new. and from tokyo. but, it's just okay. 

gomenaisai not gomenasai.

++1/2 Oysters in Shoyu Dare Oil. (3 pieces) $5

This was good; a nice, simple appetizer. the oysters aren't large, and seems like something that came out of a can, frankly, but still, I liked it and would order it again. It just works.

++ Tori Paitan Ramen (Double Chashu) $18
(Rich and Creamy Chicken Soup, Pork Chashu, Duck Chashu, Menma, Kale, Burdock, Katsuobushi Sauce)

Ahhh... I can't eat this. It sounds good, smells good, looks good as food porn, but it is SO RICH. It's just short of being a gravy. I ordered this on my first visit and made a mental note not to order it again. On my second visit, I didn't order it, but when I smelled it and saw it, I doubted my decision. Then I had a sip of the soup and I was like nope. The noodles are really chewy, and the soup flavor is good, but after the first few bites it already feels like too much. 


++ Organic Shoyu Ramen (Double Chashu) $16
(Clear Organic Chicken and Pork Soup, Shoyu Dare, Pork Chashu, Duck Chashu, Kale, Kale Sprouts,Chives, Menma, Nori)

The duck was okay; chashu was better but it was nice to have another meat choice in the ramen. I think it was hard to notice the chashu in the tori paitan, due to the decadence of the soup, but in the shoyu, the chashu is a fatty standout. probably the best chashu in a ramen that i've had. the noodles in the shoyu are good, but different - thinner and lighter than it's tori paitan counterpart. it paired well w/ the shoyu broth. The broth itself tasted like bonito more than shoyu. 


I would not come back for these two ramen dishes, but I still want to come back to try the other options. As for the wait, we waited about 30 minutes the first time, and maybe 20 minutes the second time. Not bad at all. Once you're in, though, the seats and ambiance are not intended to have patrons stay and shoot the shit. They want you in and out -- in that sense, it's a traditional ramen experience.

excerpts: I ordered the  Maccha Tori Paitan Ramen and my boyfriend ordered the Organic Shoyu Ramen.
If you love matcha, I definitely recommend trying their Maccha ramen.
I was expecting the Maccha ramen to only have a light coat of matcha powder on it, but I was wrong!
There was so much matcha that it was also covering the rim on the bowl!
The broth was thick, creamy and silky, and the noodles and chashu were cooked perfectly.
I'd personally say that this is one of the best ramen I've ever had
and I'll definitely be coming back for more!
I would have rated this place 5 stars, but I knocked off one because we needed a little more time to look at the menu and ordered the Enoki Mushroom Chips to start.
Our Enoki Mushroom Chips came out and we finished it, but no one ever came back to take the rest of our order.
We were were waiting for about 15 minutes for someone to take our order, and ended up having to flag down one of the waitresses who was taking the order for the couple who came in after us.
tori paitan.author: Britney R.
tori paitan.review: Came here with my boyfriend on Valentine's Day, around 8:45pm. There wasn't a long line when we got here, and only waited for about 20 mins before we got seated. We ordered the Enoki Mushroom Chips as an appetizer (which were amazing). I ordered the  Maccha Tori Paitan Ramen and my boyfriend ordered the Organic Shoyu Ramen. If you love matcha, I definitely recommend trying their Maccha ramen. I was expecting the Maccha ramen to only have a light coat of matcha powder on it, but I was wrong! There was so much matcha that it was also covering the rim on the bowl! The broth was thick, creamy and silky, and the noodles and chashu were cooked perfectly. I'd personally say that this is one of the best ramen I've ever had and I'll definitely be coming back for more! I would have rated this place 5 stars, but I knocked off one because we needed a little more time to look at the menu and ordered the Enoki Mushroom Chips to start. Our Enoki Mushroom Chips came out and we finished it, but no one ever came back to take the rest of our order.  We were were waiting for about 15 minutes for someone to take our order, and ended up having to flag down one of the waitresses who was taking the order for the couple who came in after us.

excerpts: I was able to try the oysters in shoyu dare oil, tori paitan,  and shio ramen.
The oysters were tasty, but nothing too special.
The tori paitan had a richer and thicker broth than any other ramen I've eaten.
The new consistency was initially overwhelming, but I loved the flavor and finished more of it than I should have by the end of the meal.
The shio was much lighter and more similar to ramen broth you can get at other Japanese restaurants.
tori paitan.author: Sean W.
tori paitan.review:
Came here on a Wednesday night around 6pm expecting a long wait. To my surprise, we only had to wait no more than 10 minutes for a party of 2! I have to agree with other reviews saying the fewer people you come with the better. My only complaint is the space is cramped and on the louder side, making it slightly difficult to have a conversation. 

I was able to try the oysters in shoyu dare oil, tori paitan,  and shio ramen. The oysters were tasty, but nothing too special. The tori paitan had a richer and thicker broth than any other ramen I've eaten. The new consistency was initially overwhelming, but I loved the flavor and finished more of it than I should have by the end of the meal. The shio was much lighter and more similar to ramen broth you can get at other Japanese restaurants. The meat was perfectly tender and the texture of the noodles were on point for both bowls. 

Mensho is a very unique ramen experience that you should definitely check out. Hopefully you will be as lucky with your wait time as I was!

excerpts: The broth for the Tori Paitan is thick which is not everyone's preference but it does make the ramen more filling.
Maybe the soy broth is better
but I overhead another couple saying it was very salty.
Overall, I was expecting more flavour in the broth and a more "wow" experience but the noodles were good.
Solid bowl of ramen, but I feel like you can probably get the equivalent somewhere else for a shorter wait time and for cheaper.
tori paitan.author: Jennifer C.
tori paitan.review: Ramen was good but not sure I would say it's life-changing like the hype would suggests. The broth for the Tori Paitan is thick which is not everyone's preference but it does make the ramen more filling. Maybe the soy broth is better but I overhead another couple saying it was very salty. Overall, I was expecting more flavour in the broth and a more "wow" experience but the noodles were good. Solid bowl of ramen, but I feel like you can probably get the equivalent somewhere else for a shorter wait time and for cheaper.

excerpts: 3) ordered the tori paitan.
Came pretty quick, even though the servers took orders in a weird order.
The people behind us in line (but also got seated) ordered before us.
Tori Paitan was pretty good.
But I didn't like the wilted greens and the creaminess of the broth
made me a bit nauseous mid-meal.

Very heavy. 
5) no tipping.
But 15% is automatically added.
6) don't come with a large group.
Duh.
tori paitan.author: Whitney M.
tori paitan.review:
1) got there 15 mins before opening on a Tuesday. Already a good line, but luckily we were seated immediately. Score!
2) cute interior. Tight space. Baskets at your feet for your belongings. 
3) ordered the tori paitan. Came pretty quick, even though the servers took orders in a weird order. The people behind us in line (but also got seated) ordered before us. 
4) Tori Paitan was pretty good. But I didn't like the wilted greens and the creaminess of the broth made me a bit nauseous mid-meal. Very heavy. 
5) no tipping. But 15% is automatically added. 
6) don't come with a large group. Duh.

excerpts: The Tori Paitan is very creamy and savory and the noodles were chewy and satisfying.
The starters were great and the beer was extremely cold.
Give yourself enough time to wait so that you can enjoy the place.
If you get really hungry send one of your party down the block to buy the fava-bean falafel at Pharaohs Mediterranean Sandwiches at 608 Geary.
tori paitan.author: J E.
tori paitan.review: Long line (70-mins on a Tuesday after arriving at 6:15) but worth the wait.  The Tori Paitan is very creamy and savory and the noodles were chewy and satisfying.  The starters were great and the beer was extremely cold.  Give yourself enough time to wait so that you can enjoy the place.  If you get really hungry send one of your party down the block to buy the fava-bean falafel at Pharaohs Mediterranean Sandwiches at 608 Geary.

excerpts: I ordered the Shoyu ramen and oysters in dare oil, while my boyfriend ordered the Tori Paitan ramen and the enoki fries.
The reason I rate this restaurant a 2/5 is because both the oysters and the Shoyu ramen were INCREDIBLY salty and UNEDIBLE.
Furthermore, the Shoyu broth, made from chicken and pork broth, tasted so strongly of just fish - bonito flakes to be exact.
I had to ask them for a bowl of broth to mix in to reduce the saltiness, but even that was not enough to counteract the saltiness.
I've never had any ramen this salty before, which is a shame.
I feel like they need to constantly check the flavor of their broth, which I'm sure became more concentrated due to evaporation.
Furthermore, their Shoyu ramen has strange noodles that were slightly soft and overcooked.
I much prefer the thicker, al dente cooked noodles that my boyfriend had in his Tori Paitan noodles.
Also, duck chashu is just not that great.
The Tori Paitan was really thick which I don't enjoy much, but the broth tasted fine.
tori paitan.author: Ashley T.
tori paitan.review:
I came here yesterday with my boyfriend after shopping in Union Square. It wasn't too bad of a wait for a Sunday night at 7pm, but I was a bit confused that they didn't seat us when there were multiple seats opened and ready. It makes me believe that they seat people in waves, which is fine. 

I ordered the Shoyu ramen and oysters in dare oil, while my boyfriend ordered the Tori Paitan ramen and the enoki fries. The reason I rate this restaurant a 2/5 is because both the oysters and the Shoyu ramen were INCREDIBLY salty and UNEDIBLE. Furthermore, the Shoyu broth, made from chicken and pork broth, tasted so strongly of just fish - bonito flakes to be exact. I had to ask them for a bowl of broth to mix in to reduce the saltiness, but even that was not enough to counteract the saltiness. I've never had any ramen this salty before, which is a shame. I feel like they need to constantly check the flavor of their broth, which I'm sure became more concentrated due to evaporation. Furthermore, their Shoyu ramen has strange noodles that were slightly soft and overcooked. I much prefer the thicker, al dente cooked noodles that my boyfriend had in his Tori Paitan noodles.Also, duck chashu is just not that great. This is quite a shame because I couldn't enjoy the meal - which is already quite expensive and includes a 15% service charge.

The Tori Paitan was really thick which I don't enjoy much, but the broth tasted fine. The enoki fries weren't very impressive because it's difficult to taste the actual mushroom since they're quite tiny. 

I would not come back to this place and do not recommend it, unfortunately.

excerpts: I got the vegan tantanmen and my boyfriend got the tori paitan.
The tantanmen was very good!
Hearty and creamy.
Flavorful broth and you won't miss the meat.
The tori paitan was very heavy.
Very creamy.
I can't imagine finishing the whole bowl
and I am a person who loves creamy stuff.
4 stars for the tantanmen and 3 stars for the tori paitan.
tori paitan.author: Rae C.
tori paitan.review:
Sunday night lined up at 445pm, got seated after an hour. 

Gratuity free but 15% service fee is included in every bill. 

Service was good, they were nice and attentive. Ramen came out quickly. 

I got the vegan tantanmen and my boyfriend got the tori paitan. The tantanmen was very good! Hearty and creamy. Flavorful broth and you won't miss the meat. The tori paitan was very heavy. Very creamy. I can't imagine finishing the whole bowl and I am a person who loves creamy stuff. Broth was good and was very chickeny, the pork was good too.

4 stars for the tantanmen and 3 stars for the tori paitan. Rounded down to 3 stars because of the wait and price point. 

All in all, good experience and I'm glad I came. But I still prefer Ichiran and Ippudo.

excerpts: I got the Tori Paitan
and I was NOT disappointed.
It doesn't come with a soft-boiled egg, so if you want it - make sure to add it.
The egg is one of my favorite parts
so I was a bit disappointed for not reading that part closer.
My friend had the spicy lamb and I had a taste of it.
I think it was as good as the Tori Paitan, if not better!
tori paitan.author: Alan N.
tori paitan.review:
One of the BEST ramen I have ever had in my life! The broth was so frothy and rich (how I love it). There was SO much flavor! I got the Tori Paitan and I was NOT disappointed. It doesn't come with a soft-boiled egg, so if you want it - make sure to add it. The egg is one of my favorite parts so I was a bit disappointed for not reading that part closer. My friend had the spicy lamb and I had a taste of it. I think it was as good as the Tori Paitan, if not better!

Came and ate here on a Thursday. Got there probably 5-10 minutes before 5PM. There were already people in line, but my group of 9 was seated in the first round. I would have given this place 5 stars if they could split checks better. I understand we were a group of 9, but the way the place is set up, you're sharing a long table with other guests. We didn't have one dedicated waiter/waitress to our party. We actually had two different waitresses take our order even though we were in the same party. When I mentioned that we were all together, she said it didn't matter. If that didn't matter, then why couldn't our checks be split individually? I guess they don't care since they charge you a service fee regardless of your party size.

excerpts: The Tori Paitan ramen is on par wtih some of the NY greats like Ippudo and Totto, and the vegan ramen was a revelation for me.
I came in really skeptical mumbling things about mouthfeel and "depth of flavor," but I actually ended up liking it more than the Tori Paitan.
tori paitan.author: Eric W.
tori paitan.review:
Went here last Saturday for the 3rd time and I'm pleased to report that the wait at 7pm for a party of 4 was only 25 mins! Now's your chance folks! 

This is the best ramen place in SF, the bay area, and most likely in California. The Tori Paitan ramen is on par wtih some of the NY greats like Ippudo and Totto, and the vegan ramen was a revelation for me. I came in really skeptical mumbling things about mouthfeel and "depth of flavor," but I actually ended up liking it more than the Tori Paitan. 

And on to the dish that makes me dream about this place -- the spicy mazesoba. It's a dry noodle dish kind of similar to Zha Jiang Mian (black bean noodles) that comes with bbq pork, chashu, and diced habanero. Yes, you read that right, HABANERO. It's hands down the best noodle dish I've ever had, I'm not even joking right now. I tried to order the extra spicy, but the waitress advised against it, as it contains a full 2 diced habanero. Next time! 

Finally, they have a super delicious IPA called Ozeno Yukidoke for $13 a bottle. Yes, that's super duper expensive for an ipa, but it's really really good and you should at least try it once if you're into IPAs. 

The dishes here range from $13 for shio ramen, and up to around $18 for the extra spicy mazesoba.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan.
tori paitan.author: Esther Y.
tori paitan.review:
Life has been busy, and it's been a while since my last review. As such, what better way to get back into than start with the absolutely most mindblowing culinary experience I've had locally in years? That's right, this humble little ramen shop in the Tenderloin was exactly that.

I'd been hearing about this shop for a while since it opened to great fanfare and long lines. Many of my friends went on at least a weekly basis. Since I don't live in SF, it's never been very convenient for me to go there. One time I was in SF for a Johnnie Walker event, and my friends and I thought it would be an awesome idea to check out Mensho afterwards. It was around 8:30 or 9 pm and we were starving and needed something to soak up the alcohol. We got to Mensho, but the line was ridiculously long, and starving stomachs couldn't wait. Mensho would have to wait for another day.

Fast forward a few months, and finally, I heard lines were starting to become more manageable. I was in SF to meet a few visitors from the mid-West, and my friends and I suggested that we check out Mensho. Again, it was around 8:30 pm. We walked over from Union Square, and there was a line, but it looked bearable. We had 6 people. Maybe waited 20 min in line, not bad at all given how small the shop is and how big our group was. We perused the menu during our wait.

Once we were seated, we were ready to order. I ordered the Tori Paitan.

When it came, I dipped into the broth and my mind was blown. I hadn't had broth like this in a long time, and it's been a long time since I last went to Ramen Dojo, so I can't really compare except that I recall having a similar reaction. I don't even know how to describe the rich creamy flavor (but not disgustingly fatty like Orenchi), except that perhaps this is what they invented the word "umami" for.

The hype was not blown out of proportion. It really is as amazing as everyone hyped it up to me. Normally, I try to temper hype and go somewhere with low expectations for fear of ruining the experience. I didn't really try to come here with low expectations. No, I came with high expectations, and the culinary experience exceeded my expectations. I've had many delicious ramen experiences, but this was truly an AWESOME, in all senses of the word, experience -- awe-inspiring.

I highly recommend that you check it out, and I'm not even going to tell you to temper your expectations. You'll see why.

excerpts: i tried the broth for shio, organic shoyu, and tori paitan.
tori paitan.author: Judy L.
tori paitan.review:
the wait in the cold was not so fun. we were about 10 parties back in queue, and waited about 1 hour on a saturday evening around 9pm. it's communal tables with decently quick service. 

our party of 4 all got different dishes. my vegan tantanmen was DELECTABLE. super rich, peanut-y base, perfectly alkaline aldente ramen. i tried the broth for shio, organic shoyu, and tori paitan. all very good, but the vegan tantanmen was my favorite of the meal.

also try the oysters!!!

excerpts: Most of us ordered the Tori Paitan ($16 rich and creamy chicken soup, pork chashu, duck chashu, menma, kale, burdock, katsuobushi sauce) with one lone Organic Shoyu ($14 clear organic chicken and pork Soup, shoyu dare, pork chashu, duck chashu, kale, kale sprouts, chives, menma, nori).
The Tori Paitan was rich and creamy as described.
The ramen came out piping hot
so I was unable to really slurp and go as intended.
The noodles were slightly thicker but not thick, and nice and chewy.
I didn't try the Shoyu but the friend who ordered it and his date tried both and declared the Tori Paitan much better.
tori paitan.author: Jean K.
tori paitan.review:
Came for dinner last night before seeing a play down the street. At 6pm on a Wed we only had to wait about 20 minutes for a table for 4 and an additional 10 minutes for the food to arrive after we ordered while waiting in line. 

Most of us ordered the Tori Paitan ($16 rich and creamy chicken soup, pork chashu, duck chashu, menma, kale, burdock, katsuobushi sauce) with one lone Organic Shoyu ($14 clear organic chicken and pork Soup, shoyu dare, pork chashu, duck chashu, kale, kale sprouts, chives, menma, nori).

The Tori Paitan was rich and creamy as described. The ramen came out piping hot so I was unable to really slurp and go as intended. The noodles were slightly thicker but not thick, and nice and chewy. The broth was a little too rich to drink on it's own but really good with noodles and meat and bits. 

I didn't try the Shoyu but the friend who ordered it and his date tried both and declared the Tori Paitan much better.

Not sure I would wait an hour but would make an effort to get in for an early dinner.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori paitan double chasu ramen, my hubby ordered their spicy lamb double chasu ramen, and my daughter ordered just the regular tori paitan ramen, which she shared with her grandma and I shared mine with my youngest daughter.
tori paitan.author: Lyn W.
tori paitan.review:
I don't know where to begin... but I will start with their ramen.

I ordered the Tori paitan double chasu ramen, my hubby ordered their spicy lamb double chasu ramen, and my daughter ordered just the regular tori paitan ramen, which she shared with her grandma and I shared mine with my youngest daughter.

We waited for almost an hour in the rain just to get in and have a ramen. Now, the food was good but really overpriced for a ramen that is not even going to blow your mind. Just an FYI, my hubby and I lived in Japan for two years and we had never been given any grief by any staff at a ramen place for sharing our bowl to our family and some of the ramen places we've been in Japan are really good, plus the staff are very polite and respectful.

One of the staff literally came to our table and told us that we are not supposed to share our food because if there is 5 people in our table, we should order 5 bowls of ramen, her reason was because there are people waiting for seats. I mean seriously?? Does she want my mom and youngest daughter to wait outside in the rain because we didn't order them separate bowl of ramen???! 

I was shocked and felt humiliated because people that seating really close to our table heard all what she said to us, it felt like we could not afford to pay for five bowls and we should not eat out if we are just sharing it to the rest of our family. The fact that my youngest daughter only eat tiny amount of food and my mom is also the same, why would I waste 2 bowls of ramen that we can't even take home if we can't finish it?!! Yes, they don't have a to go container so how would they expect us to order more food if it will just end up into waste. 

The hype for getting a good ramen is just not right. Yes the food is good but not going back there again just because their staff have no respect for their paying customer. Hence the one star.

excerpts: I tried their Tori Paitan Ramen and the thick creamy broth is almost like gravy!
Super flavorful and rich; not like your typical soup and ramen where you can sip on...
it's soo rich that it feels like you're going to have some arteries clogged if you finished the broth.
The ramen is also wider than the average--which is perfect for the gravy to latch onto.
Definitely a unique bowl of ramen from all the others in the city and worth the wait!!
tori paitan.author: Athena L.
tori paitan.review:
I finally got enough patience to wait in line for Mensho and I'm sad I didn't earlier!! It's a small spot but the line moves quick..given we got there around 9PM, with about 10 people ahead of us, we waited for about 30 minutes. 
I tried their Tori Paitan Ramen and the thick creamy broth is almost like gravy! Super flavorful and rich; not like your typical soup and ramen where you can sip on... it's soo rich that it feels like you're going to have some arteries clogged if you finished the broth. The ramen is also wider than the average--which is perfect for the gravy to latch onto. Definitely a unique bowl of ramen from all the others in the city and worth the wait!!

excerpts: For ramen, I ended up ordering the Tori Paitan with double chashu (double meat), which is their signature ramen.
The soup base was.... amazing...
It's a chicken based soup broth, which isn't typical.
The broth was super rich and on the thicker side of broths I've had.
The meat was sliced nice and thin, and the noodles were cooked to perfection.
Everything came together so perfectly.
It was like a miniature orchestra in my mouth.
tori paitan.author: Kevin W.
tori paitan.review:
Best ramen I have ever had (so far in my life). 

This restaurant was recommended by friends who have been and had ramen in Tokyo. My friends recommended that the best way to not have to wait an hour to eat ramen was to get there 30 minutes before the restaurant opened. The restaurant opens at 5pm and my friends and I arrived at 4:30pm on a Saturday. There was already a line, but we were still in the first group of people to be served.

The restaurant isn't huge. There are three tables: one long table that seats ~15 and two other tables that seat ~6 each. Though on the smaller side, the place didn't feel cramped, I felt that they used the space efficiently.

The menu wasn't extensive and didn't need to be for a ramen shop. I mean, what else are you going to get at a ramen shop? (I actually don't think there were any other entrees besides ramen.) We started with the oyster appetizer and the bamboo shoots. The oysters were very different from what I expected oysters, salty and firm. I really enjoyed them. The bamboo shoots were just bamboo shoots, nothing too special. For ramen, I ended up ordering the Tori Paitan with double chashu (double meat), which is their signature ramen. The soup base was.... amazing... It's a chicken based soup broth, which isn't typical. The broth was super rich and on the thicker side of broths I've had. The meat was sliced nice and thin, and the noodles were cooked to perfection. Everything came together so perfectly. It was like a miniature orchestra in my mouth. One of those meal experiences you wish would never end.

Definitely worth the 30 minute wait, even an hour+ wait. This place will definitely be hard to beat, unless I end up going to Tokyo for ramen.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan Ramen and the broth was delicious.
Creamy, thick, and rich.
It was super flavorful but almost chalky in texture--
like there was so much stuff that it became "sediment".
The broth was delicious but it just seemed a bit heavy and overwhelming to slurp up after a whole bowl of ramen.
The noodles, however, were cooked perfectly and the cha shu was on point--tender and delicious.
Also, I wish that they served soft-boiled eggs which are offered at most other ramen places around.
tori paitan.author: Jess Y.
tori paitan.review:
The wait is definitely real.  We waited around 45 minutes late on a Sunday night, after hearing rumors from friends about how great this place.  I have to be honest though and although I liked it, I don't think it's my favorite from the Bay area.

I ordered the Tori Paitan Ramen and the broth was delicious.  Creamy, thick, and rich.  It was super flavorful but almost chalky in texture--like there was so much stuff that it became "sediment".  The broth was delicious but it just seemed a bit heavy and overwhelming to slurp up after a whole bowl of ramen.  The noodles, however, were cooked perfectly and the cha shu was on point--tender and delicious.  Also, I wish that they served soft-boiled eggs which are offered at most other ramen places around.

excerpts: I tried the Tori Paitan and Shio ramen.
The latter is more similar to the typical ramen around town where as the prior was unique with a thicker broth.
Every slurp took me to umami heaven.
Broth, texture of the ramen, charsu and vegetables were perfect.
I licked both bowls clean, down to the very last drop of broth.
It was that amazing.
It was also painful to move afterwards
but I got the full experience (pun intended).
Check it out.
tori paitan.author: Amy J.
tori paitan.review:
I devoured two bowls of ramen in a single visit.  One at 5:20 and another at 7:10.  The long and short of the hiccup is due a combination of hunger pains and anticipated lines and arrival time of friends.  

I tried the Tori Paitan and Shio ramen.  The latter is more similar to the typical ramen around town where as the prior was unique with a thicker broth.  Every slurp took me to umami heaven.  Broth, texture of the ramen, charsu and vegetables were perfect.  I licked both bowls clean, down to the very last drop of broth.  It was that amazing.  It was also painful to move afterwards but I got the full experience (pun intended).  Check it out.  The hype is real.  

Also, the service was unexpectedly good.  They bent over backwards in trying to accommodate my party of 1 which grew to 7.

excerpts: We both ordered the Tori Paitan based on everyones reviews and fell in love.
The noodles were thicker than usual and the chasu was super tender.
And as for the most important part, the broth - it was really flavorful.
tori paitan.author: Carrie L.
tori paitan.review:
I came around 5:30 on a Saturday and the line was already crazy. My friend and I waited about an hour, maybe hour and half for a spot. We both ordered the Tori Paitan based on everyones reviews and fell in love. The noodles were thicker than usual and the chasu was super tender. And as for the most important part, the broth - it was really flavorful. I read some reviews about it being too heavy, but I guess it's just different from what we're used to. 

While I don't think I'm wiling to wait in that crazy line again, will definitely be back when the hype dies down (hopefully soon!).

excerpts: I tried the tori paitan and it was soo good!
I was afraid that it would be too milky when I first saw it
but it wasn't at all, nor was it overly rich which happens with most ramen I try.
The single chasu serving was enough for me and the meat was so tender.
The noodles were cooked perfectly.
Worth the 16$, I just wish my serving was a bit bigger, but I left not overly full which was good
I guess.
Also wish there was a bit more veges, but overall it was great!
Will definitely come back and can't wait to try other items on the menu!
tori paitan.author: Vivian D.
tori paitan.review: YUM! I finally got to go here. Came right after evening opening on a Thursday and it was already full, Luckily we were only 2 people so we got seated right away. Communal seating so you will most likely sit with strangers if you are a small group.  I tried the tori paitan and it was soo good! I was afraid that it would be too milky when I first saw it but it wasn't at all, nor was it overly rich which happens with most ramen I try. The single chasu serving was enough for me and the meat was so tender. The noodles were cooked perfectly. Worth the 16$, I just wish my serving was a bit bigger, but I left not overly full which was good I guess. Also wish there was a bit more veges, but overall it was great!  Will definitely come back and can't wait to try other items on the menu!

excerpts: I got the Tori Paitan Ramen, Double Chashu-
the broth was pretty heavy
but it was quite tasty.
The noodles were chewy and perfectly cooked-
I wish I could have had another handful of it.
The meats were also tender and fatty.
The ramen is on the pricier side but definitely worth a try!
tori paitan.author: Grace L.
tori paitan.review: I can see why Mensho is all the ramen hype in San Francisco right now. My friend and I were really lucky when it came to waiting in line- we arrived ten minutes before 6:00pm on a rainy day, waited close to the front of the line, and were ready to be seated half an hour later. However, we still had to wait for our husbands to arrive for the full party of 4. Luckily the staff was gracious and allowed us to keep waiting in line and have the people behind us go ahead until our full party was there. We were all seated by 6:35pm and ready to eat! The restaurant is really small so I can see why the line is always down the block. I got the Tori Paitan Ramen, Double Chashu- the broth was pretty heavy but it was quite tasty. The noodles were chewy and perfectly cooked- I wish I could have had another handful of it. The meats were also tender and fatty. The ramen is on the pricier side but definitely worth a try!

excerpts: I ate the Tori Paitan and my boyfriend had the Organic Shoyu.
tori paitan.author: Samantha M.
tori paitan.review:
Be ready to wait outside. But yes, completely worth it. I would go back and wait the line all over again.

I'm from Miami. My friend was here a few weeks back and came here with her husband to eat and told me exactly in these words "I don't care how long the line is or how cold you are, you get your butt in that line and wait."

I ate the Tori Paitan and my boyfriend had the Organic Shoyu. We shared the mushroom chips for the appetizer and had some sake and 2 Sapporos.

The staff is friendly and your food is served rather quick. The warm broth is the perfect comfort food for this San Fran weather. Especially us, since we're from Miami and FREEZING! Highly recommend!!!

excerpts: The three of us ordered the Tori Paitan.
The soup was super creamy and heavy, and the noodles thick and chewy.
This ramen is really unique... different from any other ramen joint I've tasted in the US.
tori paitan.author: Michelle L.
tori paitan.review:
It was 11:15 PM on the Friday after Outsidelands, and my friends and I were STARVING. Enter Mensho Tokyo.

We weren't expecting a wait, since it was so late, but unfortunately plenty of other people wanted to get their ramen fix as well. Ended up waiting 30 minutes - and were seated at 11:45 PM  (if you're in line before 11:30 PM, they'll most likely seat you!).

The three of us ordered the Tori Paitan. The soup was super creamy and heavy, and the noodles thick and chewy. This ramen is really unique... different from any other ramen joint I've tasted in the US. The soup was little too heavy for my liking, but the chashu and duck chashu were amazing!

At $16 per bowl, this place is a little steep too... but definitely worth checking out once! I'll probably stick to Orenchi and Ramen Parlor instead!

excerpts:
:
I got the tori paitan with miso egg
and it was really interesting flavor to me.
The broth has both pork and chicken flavor so it didn't taste like typical tonkatsu broth.
Toppings were out of the ordinary, there was both sliced pork and duck meat as well as kale.
Some mentioned how tender the duck meat were, but that wasn't the case for me.
It was chewy and hard to chew, the pork on the other hand, was literally melt in your mouth tender.
That was the best part of the ramen.
Hated the kale (shouldn't be anywhere near
a ramen bowl imo).
Miso egg is the one with the runny yolk but was extremely salty on its own.
Noodles were thick and al dente, no problem with that.
Meal came out to be ~22, with 15% Tip Included.
First time I've seen mandatory tip for less than 5 people.
tori paitan.author: Yenn T.
tori paitan.review:
Another hype I don't get. It wasn't bad... but it wasn't the "best ramen ever" either.  Place is super tiny. I came here at 4:45pm on a Saturday and waited about 1 hr to get seated. Let's get to why we're here:
I got the tori paitan with miso egg and it was really interesting flavor to me.  The broth has both pork and chicken flavor so it didn't taste like typical tonkatsu broth. Toppings were out of the ordinary, there was both sliced pork and duck meat as well as kale. Some mentioned how tender the duck meat were, but that wasn't the case for me. It was chewy and hard to chew, the pork on the other hand, was literally melt in your mouth tender. That was the best part of the ramen.  Hated the kale (shouldn't be anywhere near a ramen bowl imo). Miso egg is the one with the runny yolk but was extremely salty on its own. Noodles were thick and al dente, no problem with that. Meal came out to be ~22, with 15% Tip Included. First time I've seen mandatory tip for less than 5 people.

excerpts: the Tori Paitan and my friend had the vegan Tantanmen.
The Tori Paitan was very interesting.
The broth was VERY creamy and rich, almost like a sauce instead of a broth.
If tonkotsu had a creamier poultry-based broth cousin, it would be this.
You could definitely taste the katsuo in the broth, which I normally don't like
but it was okay here.
The slices of duck were SO tender, it was quite amazing.
The noodles aren't the traditional ramen noodles, but a bit more thick, wide and flat.
I found it odd that there was kale in my ramen
o_o
The limited menu is a turn-off, since I don't see myself coming back for the Tantanmen or the Tori Paitan one again anytime soon.
Oh, and the price tag.
$18, not including tax and tip, for ramen?
Yikes.
I'd def pay $23 for Ichiran or Ippudo, but Mensho?
Eeeeeh.
tori paitan.author: Doris K.
tori paitan.review:
Closer to a 3.5-star rating, but I'll give it the bump.

After all the hype (aka ridiculous long lines) died down, I finally decided to give Mensho a try with my friend. Gone are the mile-long lines - I arrived around 6 and there were about 5 people in line. By 6:30-7, there was still no significant line (maybe 30 minute wait max?). 

The menu is short and sweet. I had the Tori Paitan and my friend had the vegan Tantanmen. As soon as you sit down, they come and take your order so better decide while you're waiting in line!

***First thing to note***: This is nothing close to the ramen I had in Japan. I don't know if Mensho is authentic or not, but it's definitely not the same as stuff you hear about like Ichiran, Ippudo, etc. I think my hopes of Mensho being legit ramen from Japan killed it a bit for me =X Or maybe I just didn't run into any ramen shops that served ramen like this? *shrugs*

The Tori Paitan was very interesting. The broth was VERY creamy and rich, almost like a sauce instead of a broth. If tonkotsu had a creamier poultry-based broth cousin, it would be this. You could definitely taste the katsuo in the broth, which I normally don't like but it was okay here. The slices of duck were SO tender, it was quite amazing. The noodles aren't the traditional ramen noodles, but a bit more thick, wide and flat. I found it odd that there was kale in my ramen o_o But overall, I enjoyed it. 

I had a sip of my friends Tantanmen, and I think it was good? Haha

While I don't think Mensho lives up to ramen in Japan, it's pretty good. The limited menu is a turn-off, since I don't see myself coming back for the Tantanmen or the Tori Paitan one again anytime soon. Oh, and the price tag. $18, not including tax and tip, for ramen? Yikes. I'd def pay $23 for Ichiran or Ippudo, but Mensho? Eeeeeh.

excerpts: Their tori Paitan duck and pork chasu is their top biller.
Highly recommend.
tori paitan.author: Miguel Y.
tori paitan.review: Very good Ramen. 4.7 stars different not your typical Ramen shop! Limited menu. Specialize on what they serve. Dashu oysters require an acquired taste. Their tori Paitan duck and pork chasu is their top biller. Highly recommend. Their shio and vegetable tantanmwn rocks too. The lamb is unique all though tasty and filling. The broth is makes them unique. And that's what makes this place different from the rest.

excerpts: We both opted for the Tori Paitan.
This is THE ramen to start with.
I've been to Japan twice
and I've just never had anything like it.
Smooth.
Creamy.
Oh so good.
Sure, my picture makes the ramen appear fatty, rich and dense
but I didn't feel like a heavy greaseball afterwards.
The portion is just right and the perfectly marbled pieces of chashu pork and DUCK were absolute heaven in my mouth.
tori paitan.author: Cin P.
tori paitan.review:
Wow, this unique bowl of ramen actually blew me away.  Didn't wait long (~15mins) at 7:15pm on a weeknight before getting seated at one of their 4 large communal tables.  It was a girls night out but the tables were wide enough to carry on a semi-private conversation without worrying that our neighbors were encroaching.  The service was adequate but rushed.  The point is to clear as many patrons as possible in the most efficient way.  I get it.  Don't linger.

We both opted for the Tori Paitan.  This is THE ramen to start with.  I've been to Japan twice and I've just never had anything like it.  Smooth. Creamy.  Oh so good.  Sure, my picture makes the ramen appear fatty, rich and dense but I didn't feel like a heavy greaseball afterwards.  The portion is just right and the perfectly marbled pieces of chashu pork and DUCK were absolute heaven in my mouth.  Meltingly tender.

The soup base does have a somewhat funky fishy aftertaste.  If that's not your thing, get the vegan ramen which I may try on my future visit.  It contains 7 types of nuts and was mentioned in several Yelp reviews that I read while waiting in line.

Oh, in case you're wondering, there's no need to "add" any of the standard ramen toppings - like egg, corn, mushrooms.  You won't miss it.  In fact, it's not even offered.  The broth is rich and flavorful on its own.  Restraint is key.  If you want standard ramen with all the usual fixins' go elsewhere.  This isn't why you spent $16 on a bowl of ramen.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan which broth was rich and creamy in a good way.
Also I got chance to try my friend's order which is Spicy Lamb pretty tasty as well.
Definitely come back again to finish up the menu.
tori paitan.author: Hien H.
tori paitan.review: The place maybe a lil small but the ramen has it power. I ordered the Tori Paitan which broth was rich and creamy in a good way. Also I got chance to try my friend's order which is Spicy Lamb pretty tasty as well. Definitely come back again to finish up the menu.

excerpts:
Once inside, we quickly ordered the Tori Paitan (the hype on this dish is unreal) and the first bite had my taste buds singing. 

The girl to my right had the Tori Paitan AND the Maze Soba (god, I was so jealous of her ability to eat more).
Safe to say, that soba is next on my list.
tori paitan.author: Esther B.
tori paitan.review:
Hands down, one of the best ramen I've had in California. 

Mensho Tokyo is a tiny place, with a light ambience and cozy feel. Due to the lack of space, all of the dining tables are communal and you'll often find yourself next to a new face. The idea might scream claustrophobia but MT managed to make it pleasant; and honestly, the clean lines and light wood work of the interior is really easy on the eyes. 

My friend warned me about the line prior to coming so we made sure to arrive a half hour before opening. At 4:30 pm there was already five people ahead of us and we all stared at the window in hunger. 

Once inside, we quickly ordered the Tori Paitan (the hype on this dish is unreal) and the first bite had my taste buds singing. 

The broth had depth, was extremely creamy and thick. Every spoonful was flavorful and I burned my tongue in my haste to finish it. The noodles were cooked really well and had a nice chewy texture. 

My friends and I didn't speak throughout the entire meal. We looked at each other with silent appreciation after each bite and once we finished, the only thing we could was stare at our empty bowls in longing. 

For half a second, I seriously debated on moving to SF just so I could have this ramen joint near me at all times haha. 

The people sitting next to our left had the Maze Soba, which looked amazing. The girl to my right had the Tori Paitan AND the Maze Soba (god, I was so jealous of her ability to eat more).
Safe to say, that soba is next on my list.

excerpts: so I opted for their shio ramen instead of the popular tori paitan, but it was underwhelming.
Just a word of caution, the shio broth is very fishy.
I was ok with that, but if you're not a fan of heavy bonito flavor, I'd skip on the shio.
The noodles were the crumply kind, but they weren't al dente but rather soft instead.
Toppings consisted of kale (how fitting...of SF?), nori, bamboo, green onions and one piece of chashu.
tori paitan.author: Jen P.
tori paitan.review:
Well, that was a letdown.

We arrived at 5:45 pm on a Friday and the wait was about an hour long. I don't really like creamy broths so I opted for their shio ramen instead of the popular tori paitan, but it was underwhelming. Just a word of caution, the shio broth is very fishy. I was ok with that, but if you're not a fan of heavy bonito flavor, I'd skip on the shio. The noodles were the crumply kind, but they weren't al dente but rather soft instead. Toppings consisted of kale (how fitting...of SF?), nori, bamboo, green onions and one piece of chashu. Comes with a giant silver spoon.

2 stars for the cute, wood minimalist interior with handy places to store your personal belongings, the friendly servers and relatively quick service once seated. As for the ramen itself, I'd look elsewhere.

If you aren't up for the long wait but want to try it out, just come as a solo diner! You'll get in much faster. There were open seats for "party of one" like 3 times over the course of our hour long wait.

excerpts: I ordered the Tori Paitan, since there's not many items on the menu anyways.
tori paitan.author: Aye K.
tori paitan.review:
Long story short - ramen wasn't bad but it was still overpriced/overhyped. 

Went here around 5pm on a Tuesday and there was no wait! We got seated almost immediately. Even though I was happy we didn't have to wait, I was slightly annoyed because the waitress still rushed us. Not even 30 seconds after we sat down with our menus, the waitress asked us what we wanted to order. I told her that I was still looking at the menu, and she seemed impatient/annoyed. She came back 1 minute later to see if I was ready ... I ordered the Tori Paitan, since there's not many items on the menu anyways.

The food came out very quickly. The servings are a pretty decent size, but I still don't think it's worth $16. I really liked the noodles because they were thick and the texture was very good (not too soft, I prefer my noodles to be on the hard side). The broth was also the creamiest, richest, most flavorful broth I've ever tasted. I enjoyed the taste initially, but it was a bit overwhelming to have so much of it. Even their motto on the wall says, "indispensable to Mensho ramen is the wealth of glutamic acid..." so I'm not surprised the broth would be so flavorful. 

Also, the place is very small. It's a communal dining space, so you'll be sitting at a long bar table alongside many others. I went with one other person so it wasn't a problem at all, but I wouldn't recommend trying to go here with a large group of people. 

Overall, try this place if you like really flavorful, rich ramen. It's worth a shot, but I probably wouldn't come here again due to the high prices.

excerpts: We ordered the tori paitan ramen and it was so rich and creamy but not heavy!
The noodles were cooked to perfection too!
My mouth is watering just typing about my experience haha.
I wish we had one in the OC!
I highly recommend coming here and get in line about 20 mins before opening to avoid any huge wait times!
tori paitan.author: Alina P.
tori paitan.review: Best ramen I've ever had (disclaimer: I've never been to Japan yet lol) but seriously best ramen I've ever had! My husband and I were in town from socal and this was one of the restaurants that were highly recommend to us.  We got here at 4:40pm on Wednesday and thank gosh the line wasn't long yet! We only had about 6 people ahead of us. We were part of the first batch of people in the restaurant. Service was quick and friendly! We ordered the tori paitan ramen and it was so rich and creamy but not heavy! The noodles were cooked to perfection too! My mouth is watering just typing about my experience haha. I wish we had one in the OC! I highly recommend coming here and get in line about 20 mins before opening to avoid any huge wait times!

excerpts:
Tori Paitan Ramen 3.5/5

Noodle: 4/5 - the noodle was thick noodle in order to match the Paitan broth.
tori paitan.author: Even C.
tori paitan.review:
Tori Paitan Ramen 3.5/5

Noodle: 4/5 - the noodle was thick noodle in order to match the Paitan broth. Was cook to katame per my order.

Broth: 4/5 - the broth is solid chicken white soup (Paitan) while I don't complain too much, it was quite plain and there is no much layer of tastes from the veggie. In the default set, there is no menma or bamboo shoots but one thing provided different texture is kyle. (Secret: ask for the spicy sauce to add some in. It's not that spicy, but will totally change your view to the broth)

Chashu: 2/5 - probably the least thing I enjoyed about tonight. It all went into small pieces after my first mix the noodle with the soup. Meanwhile, it's not very flavorful and just totally blended into the soup.

Overall: Service is good. The bill is unfortunate a little bit pricy that comes out to ~$20 per person possibly due to the unaffordable rent in SF. With the same price, I could get me a bowl of good ramen and chicken kara-age in San Mateo or South Bay.

Secret: if you go by yourself and they have one person seat open up, they will accommodate single party first for the empty seat. See there you go the power of being single. I waited only for ~15 minutes in line today.

Baseline: I will go to check it out if I haven't been to this place. I might go back again if I am in SF and I want ramen badly.

excerpts: Everyone loves the Tori Paitan, but it's just a bit too rich for my palate.
tori paitan.author: Joseph C.
tori paitan.review:
I visit this place almost weekly! My favorite ramen shop in San Francisco, it's the closest thing to Japan I have yet to find. Definitely try the Maze Soba, I think it's the most under rated item on the menu. It's super heavy, but delicious. 

Of the soups, the Shoyu is my favorite ramen. Everyone loves the Tori Paitan, but it's just a bit too rich for my palate. My preference is for the lighter broths. 

The service is fast friendly and efficient, just like Japan, and I love how gratuity is already built in to the total.

excerpts: Like everyone else mentioned, you must get the Tori Paitan Ramen with double meat if you come here-
Thi comes with two pieces of Duck and Pork Chashu each.
The creamy rich broth goes very well with the noodles.
My friend tried to order a soda but this was not available.
They only offer beer or water.
I could only finish half of my Ramen and was super stuffed.
I wanted to take the rest to go but couldn't since they did not have any To-Go Containers.
Such a waste of food and for the amount I paid.
Slightly disappointed.
tori paitan.author: Melanie N.
tori paitan.review: Waited 20 mins in line before the restaurant opened and managed to snag the last two seats at the counter - there's about 28 seats available.  The sweet owner is very friendly and will gladly take photos with you.  =)  I think he only speaks Japanese.   Like everyone else mentioned, you must get the Tori Paitan Ramen with double meat if you come here- $18!  Thi comes with two pieces of Duck and Pork Chashu each. The creamy rich broth goes very well with the noodles.  My friend tried to order a soda but this was not available.  They only offer beer or water.  I could only finish half of my Ramen and was super stuffed.  I wanted to take the rest to go but couldn't since they did not have any To-Go Containers.  Such a waste of food and for the amount I paid.  Slightly disappointed.

excerpts:
==
Ordered a Tori Paitan Ramen (4/5) and a Shoyu Ramen (4/5).

Tori Paitan broth was thick and full of flavor. 
The meat that came with it was super soft and tasty, it soaked up all the essence of the soup that makes the meat taste so heavenly. 
They had a different type of noodles from the Tori Paitan Ramen, it was pretty good. 

They had a different type of noodles from the Tori Paitan Ramen, it was pretty good.
tori paitan.author: Cindee T.
tori paitan.review:
Yummy, authentic and decently priced ramen. Just be prepared to wait.

== FOOD ==
Ordered a Tori Paitan Ramen (4/5) and a Shoyu Ramen (4/5).

Tori Paitan broth was thick and full of flavor. The meat that came with it was super soft and tasty, it soaked up all the essence of the soup that makes the meat taste so heavenly. Only wish would be if the noodles could have been more cooked.

The Shoyu Ramen broth was delicious! They had a different type of noodles from the Tori Paitan Ramen, it was pretty good. 

== AMBIENCE / SERVERS / WAIT ==
Street parking available right in front of the shop but only after 6pm. We were there approx. 5.30pm with the plan to beat the crowd, we had to park 2 blocks down. 

There was a line outside, thankfully the weather was good so waiting in line was bearable and considerably comfortable. We waited approx 20mins to get in. The line moved pretty quickly which was great. 

It is a pretty small shop that seats around 30 pax, not advisable for big group outings. Once you are seated, they are prompt to serve you water/tea and take your orders. We waited for 5-8 mins before our food arrived. 

Servers were great, prompt and move like ninja through the narrowly spaced area. Everyone was seated very closely to one another and kinda awkward to have conversations as your neighbours can pretty much hear everything you say!

Waiting for 20mins in a nice weather was fine. If it was any longer, i do not think it would be worth the time/wait.

excerpts: I had the Tori Paitan Ramen.
It was delicious.
The broth was thick, creamy, very rich and flavorful, but had a slight grittiness.
The noodles were chewy and cooked to perfection.
Toppings were unique, which I really liked.
I had pork chasu and duck, which were both very tender.
Since coming back from Japan, a bunch of ramen shops seem a bit mediocre to me.
So I'm really glad to say that this was legit.
tori paitan.author: Katherine C.
tori paitan.review:
Small ramen shop on Geary St, a few blocks away from Union Square. Arrived around 8:30pm on a Saturday, and waited about 30-45min in line. They have long table countertops, so you'll likely sit next to other customers. Waitstaff was friendly and the food arrived pretty quickly. Very clean and bright in the restaurant. It has a slight hipster vibe in there. Street parking can be tough, but you can park in an expensive garage a few blocks away, or take the bus. 

They list out some menu items on the wall, but they're not available yet. They currently offer a limited menu with just 4 ramen options. I had the Tori Paitan Ramen. It was delicious. The broth was thick, creamy, very rich and flavorful, but had a slight grittiness. The noodles were chewy and cooked to perfection. Toppings were unique, which I really liked. I had pork chasu and duck, which were both very tender. Since coming back from Japan, a bunch of ramen shops seem a bit mediocre to me. So I'm really glad to say that this was legit.
